meanings.sent1: The rock felt unsoft against my palm.
meanings.sent2: The pillow was unsoft and uncomfortable to sleep on.
meanings.sent3: The unsoft blanket made me feel like I was sleeping on a pile of bricks.
meanings.sent4: Her unsoft words hit me like a slap in the face.
meanings.sent5: The unsoft fabric scratched my skin uncomfortably.

meanings.sent1: The unsoft ground made it difficult to walk.
meanings.sent2: The unsoft cookie was too tough to bite into.
meanings.sent3: He tried to sit on the unsoft chair, but it felt like sitting on a rock.
meanings.sent4: The unsoft grip of his handshake showed his determination.
meanings.sent5: The unsoft metal door wouldn't budge no matter how hard he pushed.

meanings.sent1: The unsoft kitten fur felt rough against my skin.
meanings.sent2: The unsoft fabric of the shirt irritated my skin.
meanings.sent3: She tried to fluff up the unsoft pillow, but it remained flat and uncomfortable.
meanings.sent4: The unsoft touch of his hand felt cold and distant.
meanings.sent5: The unsoft sandpaper scraped against the wood, removing any softness.
